H0.text: Element is the term that best describes iron oxide, which is formed when iron chemically combines with oxygen and is also known as rust.

H1.text: Mixture is the term that best describes iron oxide, which is formed when iron chemically combines with oxygen.

H2.text: Solution is the term that best describes iron oxide, also known as rust, which is formed when iron chemically combines with oxygen.

H3.text: Compound is the term that best describes iron oxide, which is also known as rust and is formed when iron chemically combines with oxygen.

A4.text: An iron oxide is a chemical compound composed of iron and oxygen.

A5.text: Ferric oxyhydroxides are a related class of compounds, perhaps the best known of which is rust.
